"BC Environmental Monitoring System Data" (dataset). 3.0.0. DataStream. https://doi.org/10.25976/yhbt-cb49.</gco:CharacterString>

                            </gmd:organisationName>
                            <gmd:role>

                            </gmd:organisationName>

                    </gmd:citedResponsibleParty>
                    <gmd:citedResponsibleParty>
                        <gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty>
                            <gmd:organisationName>
                                <gco:CharacterString>authorized third parties</gco:CharacterString>
                            </gmd:organisationName>
                            <gmd:role>
                                <gmd:CI_RoleCode
                                        codeList="https://schemas.isotc211.org/19115/-3/cit/1.0/codelists.xml#CI_RoleCode"

                        </gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty>
                    </gmd:citedResponsibleParty>
                </gmd:CI_Citation>
            </gmd:citation>
            <gmd:abstract>
                <gco:CharacterString>The Environmental Monitoring System (EMS) is the ministry's primary data repository for
environmental monitoring data. The system was designed to capture data covering physical, chemical,
and biological analyses performed on water, air, soil, and waste discharges, as well as data from
ambient monitoring throughout the province. 

Samples are collected by either ministry staff, permit holders under the Environmental Management
Act, or authorized third parties and are analyzed in public or private sector laboratories. If the sampling
is conducted as part of a permit requirement the sample must be analyzed at a qualified laboratory.
The majority of monitoring data is entered into EMS electronically via Electronic Data Transfer (EDT).

The dataset shared on DataStream contains the EMS ambient surface water monitoring data. The original data can also be accessed from https://cat.data.gov.bc.ca/dataset/bc-environmental-monitoring-system-results.</gco:CharacterString>
            </gmd:abstract>
            <gmd:credit gco:nilReason="missing"/>

            </gmd:language>

            </gmd:topicCategory>

                    <gmd:geographicElement>
                        <gmd:EX_GeographicBoundingBox>

                                <gco:Boolean>1</gco:Boolean>
                            </gmd:extentTypeCode>
                            <gmd:westBoundLongitude>

                                    <gml:beginPosition>1965-01-03T12:00:00+00:00</gml:beginPosition>
                                    <gml:endPosition>2023-06-11T13:55:00+00:00</gml:endPosition>
                                </gml:TimePeriod>
                            </gmd:extent>
                        </gmd:EX_TemporalExtent>
                    </gmd:temporalElement>
                    <gmd:verticalElement>

name: 10-25976-yhbt-cb49
notes:
The Environmental Monitoring System (EMS) is the ministry's primary data repository for
environmental monitoring data. The system was designed to capture data covering physical, chemical,
and biological analyses performed on water, air, soil, and waste discharges, as well as data from
ambient monitoring throughout the province. 

Samples are collected by either ministry staff, permit holders under the Environmental Management
Act, or authorized third parties and are analyzed in public or private sector laboratories. If the sampling
is conducted as part of a permit requirement the sample must be analyzed at a qualified laboratory.
The majority of monitoring data is entered into EMS electronically via Electronic Data Transfer (EDT).

The dataset shared on DataStream contains the EMS ambient surface water monitoring data. The original data can also be accessed from https://cat.data.gov.bc.ca/dataset/bc-environmental-monitoring-system-results.

notes_translated.en:
The Environmental Monitoring System (EMS) is the ministry's primary data repository for
environmental monitoring data. The system was designed to capture data covering physical, chemical,
and biological analyses performed on water, air, soil, and waste discharges, as well as data from
ambient monitoring throughout the province. 

Samples are collected by either ministry staff, permit holders under the Environmental Management
Act, or authorized third parties and are analyzed in public or private sector laboratories. If the sampling
is conducted as part of a permit requirement the sample must be analyzed at a qualified laboratory.
The majority of monitoring data is entered into EMS electronically via Electronic Data Transfer (EDT).

The dataset shared on DataStream contains the EMS ambient surface water monitoring data. The original data can also be accessed from https://cat.data.gov.bc.ca/dataset/bc-environmental-monitoring-system-results.
notes_translated.fr:
Le Système de surveillance environnementale (EMS) est le principal référentiel de données du ministère pour
données de surveillance environnementale. Le système a été conçu pour recueillir des données concernant les aspects physiques, chimiques,
et des analyses biologiques effectuées sur l'eau, l'air, le sol et les rejets de déchets, ainsi que des données provenant de
surveillance de la température ambiante dans l'ensemble de la province. 

Les échantillons sont prélevés soit par le personnel du ministère, soit par les titulaires de permis dans le cadre de la gestion environnementale
Agissent ou des tiers autorisés et sont analysés dans des laboratoires du secteur public ou privé. Si l'échantillonnage
est effectué dans le cadre d'une exigence de permis ; l'échantillon doit être analysé dans un laboratoire qualifié.
La majorité des données de surveillance sont saisies électroniquement dans l'EMS par transfert électronique de données (EDT).

L'ensemble de données partagé sur DataStream contient les données de surveillance de l'eau de surface ambiante de l'EMS. Les données originales sont également accessibles à l'adresse https://cat.data.gov.bc.ca/dataset/bc-environmental-monitoring-system-results.

description_translated.en: DataStream is an open access platform for sharing water and sediment quality data.
description_translated.fr: DataStream est une plateforme en libre accès pour partager des données sur la qualité de l'eau et des sédiments.
